abstract: Nissan forecast a loss for the current year and said it was cutting 20,000 workers in one of the most aggressive cutbacks so far by a Japanese company since the start of the global downturn.
snippet: Nissan forecast a loss for the current year and said it was cutting 20,000 workers in one of the most aggressive cutbacks so far by a Japanese company since the start of the global downturn.
lead_paragraph: HONG KONG  Nissan Motor joined Toyota, Mazda and Mitsubishi on Monday in forecasting a loss for the current financial year, and announced it was cutting 20,000 workers in one of the most aggressive cutbacks so far by a Japanese company since the start of the global downturn.

headline.print_headline: Nissan to Cut 20,000 Jobs Amid Loss
